location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Printed letter No.1294/344 of 1872 from Lieutenant-Colonel Lewis Pelly,H.B.M.'s Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire to the Secretary of Government, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter encloses is a translation and account of the Tenets of the Ibadhi Sect of 'Oman' taken from a manuscript Arabic work entitled 'The Keshf-ul-Ghummeh of the Sheikh Sirh√¢n bin Mohammed-el-Alawi, a native of 'Oman'.The translation and notation was undertaken by Lieutenant-Colonel Edward Charles Ross and certified as a true copy by Joseph Charles Edwards, assistant resident in the Persian Gulf, 11 July 1872.Another copy of this letter can be found within the file at folios 54-59.
